string: Go to the Douglas, and deliver him
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Up to his pleasure, ransomless and free:
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: His valour shown upon our crests to-day
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Hath taught us how to cherish such high deeds
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: Even in the bosom of our adversaries.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

string: LANCASTER
speaker: LANCASTER

string: I thank your grace for this high courtesy,
speaker: LANCASTER

string: Which I shall give away immediately.
speaker: LANCASTER

string: KING HENRY IV
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Then this remains, that we divide our power.
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: You, son John, and my cousin Westmoreland
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Towards York shall bend you with your dearest speed,
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: To meet Northumberland and the prelate Scroop,
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Who, as we hear, are busily in arms:
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Myself and you, son Harry, will towards Wales,
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: To fight with Glendower and the Earl of March.
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Rebellion in this land shall lose his sway,
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Meeting the cheque of such another day:
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: And since this business so fair is done,
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Let us not leave till all our own be won.
speaker: KING HENRY IV

string: Exeunt
